column5: That ol' saying about the 'fishies bitin' best,' I'm wondering if this means ALL west winds . . . .   even typhoon force ones? Ah h h  h . . . .     well, if nuthin' more, it'll blow the 'skeeters & black flies away. Watta way to start a holiday . . .    -3, with up to 45 klick breeze . . . .    THE FIRST WEEK OF APRIL?? Oh well . . .   if anybody else happens to be out east this mornin,' I'm the guy just south of the trestle, shivering, & runnin' a float down the river, in front of the black van. Bring a tape measure to record the 32" 'bow I'm gonna hook!
Have a great day Steve & let us know how you make out.
Geeze Lew . . . .    doncha ever get a hankering to go hook into a nice trout to keep in practice for when YOUR fish are available?
BRING ON A TWISTER AND YOU KNOW I'LL STILL BE DRIFTING  LOL
Good luck to you Steve!  I wish that i could be out there ... stupid work ...

Eastern tribs resembled fast flowing chocolate milk . . .    I did fish a fairly sheltered spot for a few hours, but the wind switched to the northwest, at about 30 klicks, and with -5 temp, I decided I really wasn't all that keen on trout for supper . . .   maybe I'll open a can of tuna . . . .   better chemicals, eh!
Well at least you got out Steve ! Better luck next time !
